      "ff0bf12e-2b73-4759-9339-8e070a900066": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_time": 1552023080633,
          "id": "ff0bf12e-2b73-4759-9339-8e070a900066",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_time": 1552023080633,
          "parent_id": "8439a430-dcf1-4662-9d33-b65592b2dbfb",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "$_SERVER is an array containing information such as headers, paths, and script locations. The entries in this array are created by the web server. There is no guarantee that every web server will provide any of these; servers may omit some, or provide others not listed here. That said, a large number of these variables are accounted for in the CGI/1.1 specification, so you should be able to expect those."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "quote",
          "version": 1
        }
      }
    },
    "notion_user": {
      "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a": {
        "role": "reader",
        "value": {

                    "b"

                ]
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

            "title": [

                "Unlike the aforementioned superglobals, cookies must be created with a function (and not be assigning a value). The convention is below."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1

              [
                "// ensure there isn't an error\nif ($_FILES[\"myVar\"][\"error\"] == UPLOAD_ERR_OK)\n{\n    $folderLocation = \"myFiles\"; // a relative path. (could be \"path/to/file\" for example)\n    \n    // if the folder doesn't exist then make it\n    if (!file_exists($folderLocation)) mkdir($folderLocation);\n\n    // move the file into the folder\n    move_uploaded_file($_FILES[\"myVar\"][\"tmp_name\"], \"$folderLocation/\" . basename($_FILES[\"myVar\"][\"name\"]));\n}"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1

        "role": "comment_only",

          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",

          "last_edited_time": 1552023080642,
          "parent_id": "8439a430-dcf1-4662-9d33-b65592b2dbfb",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [
              [
                "Plain Text"
              ]
            ],
            "title": [
              [
                "$total = isset($_FILES[\"myVar\"]) ? count($_FILES[\"myVar\"][\"name\"]) : 0; // count how many files were sent\n// iterate over each of the files\nfor ($i = 0; $i \u003c $total; $i++)\n{\n    // there isn't an error\n    if ($_FILES[\"myVar\"][\"error\"][$i] == UPLOAD_ERR_OK)\n    {\n        $folderLocation = \"myFiles\"; // a relative path. (could be \"path/to/file\" for example)\n        \n        // if the folder doesn't exist then make it\n        if (!file_exists($folderLocation)) mkdir($folderLocation);\n\n        // move the file into the folder\n        move_uploaded_file($_FILES[\"myVar\"][\"tmp_name\"][$i], \"$folderLocation/\" . basename($_FILES[\"myVar\"][\"name\"][$i]));\n    }\n    // else report the error\n    else switch ($_FILES[\"myVar\"][\"error\"][$i])\n    {\n        case UPLOAD_ERR_INI_SIZE:\n            echo \"Value: 1; The uploaded file exceeds the upload_max_filesize directive in php.ini.\";\n            break;\n        case UPLOAD_ERR_FORM_SIZE:\n            echo \"Value: 2; The uploaded file exceeds the MAX_FILE_SIZE directive that was specified in the HTML form.\";\n            break;\n        case UPLOAD_ERR_PARTIAL:\n            echo \"Value: 3; The uploaded file was only partially uploaded.\";\n            break;\n        case UPLOAD_ERR_NO_FILE:\n            echo \"Value: 4; No file was uploaded.\";\n            break;\n        case UPLOAD_ERR_NO_TMP_DIR:\n            echo \"Value: 6; Missing a temporary folder. Introduced in PHP 5.0.3.\";\n            break;\n        case UPLOAD_ERR_CANT_WRITE:\n            echo \"Value: 7; Failed to write file to disk. Introduced in PHP 5.1.0.\";\n            break;\n        case UPLOAD_ERR_EXTENSION:\n            echo \"Value: 8; A PHP extension stopped the file upload. PHP does not provide a way to ascertain which extension caused the file upload to stop; examining the list of loaded extensions with phpinfo() may help. Introduced in PHP 5.2.0.\";\n            break;\n        \n        default:\n            echo \"An unknown error has occured.\";\n            break;\n    }\n}"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

          "last_edited_time": 1552023080643,
          "parent_id": "8439a430-dcf1-4662-9d33-b65592b2dbfb",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "Using the for loop allows an iteration of the "
              ],
              [
                "$_FILES",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " array and accessing each item one at a time. If that file doesn’t encounter a problem then the if statement is true and the code from the single file upload is run."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      }
    },
    "notion_user": {
      "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a": {
        "role": "reader",
